musicalLanguage.description: The famous opening of Beethoven's 'Moonlight' Sonata — a hypnotic wash of broken triads over a deep bass pedal. The right hand spins continuous triplet arpeggios while the left provides the harmonic foundation. It's one of the most recognizable openings in all of classical music.
musicalLanguage.structure: Through-composed (this excerpt covers the opening 8 bars of the exposition)
keyMoments: Bar 1: The iconic C# minor triplet pattern establishes the moonlit atmosphere
Bar 5: The melody emerges in the top voice of the arpeggios — listen for the singing tone
Bar 7-8: Harmonic shift toward the dominant (G# major) creates gentle tension
teachingGoals: Even triplet rhythm — all three notes equal, no accents on beat 1
Pedal technique: long pedal changes per harmony, not per beat
Voicing: bring out the top note of each triplet group as the melody
styleTips: pp throughout — this is moonlight, not a thunderstorm
Sustain pedal changes with the harmony, not mechanically per bar
Let the top voice sing; the inner notes are accompaniment texture

measures.rightHand: G#3:e E4:e G#4:e G#3:e E4:e G#4:e G#3:e E4:e G#4:e G#3:e E4:e G#4:e
measures.teachingNote: Keep the triplets perfectly even — count 'one-and-a two-and-a three-and-a four-and-a'

measures.rightHand: G#3:e E4:e G#4:e G#3:e E4:e G#4:e G#3:e E4:e G#4:e G#3:e E4:e G#4:e
measures.teachingNote: Same pattern, new bass note — let the harmony shift color the mood

measures.rightHand: A3:e E4:e A4:e A3:e E4:e A4:e A3:e E4:e A4:e A3:e E4:e A4:e
measures.teachingNote: Notice how A natural brightens the color — we've moved to A major briefly

measures.rightHand: G#3:e E4:e G#4:e G#3:e E4:e G#4:e G#3:e D#4:e F#4:e G#3:e D#4:e F#4:e
measures.teachingNote: The second half introduces D# and F# — the harmony is shifting toward the dominant

measures.rightHand: G#3:e C#4:e E4:e G#3:e C#4:e E4:e G#3:e C#4:e E4:e G#3:e C#4:e E4:e
measures.teachingNote: Back to C# minor — the melody note (E) now sits on top. Voice it louder than the others.

measures.rightHand: G#3:e B3:e E4:e G#3:e B3:e E4:e G#3:e B3:e E4:e G#3:e B3:e E4:e
measures.teachingNote: E major chord — a moment of warmth before the music darkens again

measures.rightHand: A3:e C#4:e E4:e A3:e C#4:e E4:e G#3:e B#3:e E4:e G#3:e B#3:e E4:e
measures.teachingNote: B# (enharmonic C) in the second half creates the augmented chord tension — lean into it slightly

measures.rightHand: G#3:e C#4:e E4:e G#3:e C#4:e E4:e G#3:e C#4:e E4:e G#3:e C#4:e E4:e
measures.teachingNote: Resolution back to C# minor — let the tension dissolve. Breathe.
